meanings.definition: a person who holds a copy of a document or text
meanings.sent1: The copyholder carefully kept the document safe.
meanings.sent2: The copyholder read the text aloud to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The copyholder joked that they were the guardian of all the words.
meanings.sent4: She was like a copyholder, preserving the ancient manuscript.
meanings.sent5: The diligent copyholder memorized every word of the document.

meanings.definition: a device used to hold papers or books open for reading or typing
meanings.sent1: The copyholder on the desk kept the book open.
meanings.sent2: She used the copyholder to type without holding the pages.
meanings.sent3: The copyholder decided to take a break and hold a book instead.
meanings.sent4: The copyholder stood like a loyal assistant, keeping the pages in place.
meanings.sent5: With the copyholder, she could easily read and type at the same time.
